dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: I'd love to hear about how you ended up defecting to the West.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: It was in the late 70s, during a tour with the ballet company. We were in Paris. I decided to stay.

sentence_annotations.text: It was in the late 70s, during a tour with the ballet company. We were in Paris. I decided to stay.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like a bold decision. What was going through your mind at the time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: I felt trapped, you know? The restrictions, the constant surveillance. In Paris, I saw freedom. It was an opportunity I couldnâ€™t pass up.

sentence_annotations.text: I felt trapped, you know? The restrictions, the constant surveillance. In Paris, I saw freedom.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That must have been hard, leaving everything behind. How did you cope with being in a new place?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: It was difficult at first. I missed my family, my friends. But the ballet community here was welcoming. They helped me find my footing.

sentence_annotations.text: It was difficult at first. I missed my family, my friends. But the ballet community here was welcoming. They helped me find my footing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: So when did things change for you after you settled in the West?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: Things really changed when I injured my knee. It was a turning point.

sentence_annotations.text: Things really changed when I injured my knee. It was a turning point.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That must have been devastating, especially for a dancer. How did it happen?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: During a rehearsal, I landed awkwardly after a jump. It was immediate pain, and I knew it was bad.

sentence_annotations.text: During a rehearsal, I landed awkwardly after a jump. It was immediate pain, and I knew it was bad.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: What were some of the core challenges you faced during your recovery?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: The hardest part was accepting that my career as a performer was over. The doctors said I wouldn't dance again professionally.

sentence_annotations.text: The hardest part was accepting that my career as a performer was over. The doctors said I wouldn't dance again professionally.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That must have been incredibly tough to hear. How did you manage to move forward after that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: I had to find a new purpose. Teaching became my focus.

sentence_annotations.text: I had to find a new purpose. Teaching became my focus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: Teaching must have been a big adjustment. What was it like transitioning from performing to teaching?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: Transitioning wasn't easy. I had to learn patience. Teaching is different; you guide others rather than express yourself.

sentence_annotations.text: Transitioning wasn't easy. I had to learn patience.
Teaching is different; you guide others rather than express yourself.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: I'd love to hear how teaching kids has been for you now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: Teaching kids is rewarding. They have so much energy and potential. It feels good to pass on what I've learned.

sentence_annotations.text: Teaching kids is rewarding. They have so much energy and potential.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like teaching has brought you a lot of fulfillment. How do you feel looking back at your journey from dancer to teacher?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: Looking back, I see it as a full circle. I miss performing, but teaching gives me a sense of purpose I didn't expect.

sentence_annotations.text: Looking back, I see it as a full circle. I miss performing, but teaching gives me a sense of purpose I didn't expect.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: So, how do you feel about the impact you've had on your students over the years?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: I hope I've inspired them. That's all a teacher can ask for.

sentence_annotations.text: I hope I've inspired them. That's all a teacher can ask for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: That's a wonderful sentiment. What's one of your proudest moments as a teacher?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: There's a student who went on to join a professional company. Seeing them succeed felt like a piece of my own journey continued.

sentence_annotations.text: There's a student who went on to join a professional company. Seeing them succeed felt like a piece of my own journey continued.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_turns.text: Before we finish, what's one final lesson you'd share with those aspiring to follow in your footsteps?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Subject
dialogue_turns.text: Never stop learning. Life will change, and you must adapt. Embrace every stage.

sentence_annotations.text: Never stop learning. Life will change, and you must adapt. Embrace every stage.
